New Records: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam against the Dodgers in the third inning during Game 4 of the World Series
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam against the Dodgers in the third inning
Austin Wells hit a home run in the sixth inning
Gleyber Torres hit a three-run jack in the eighth inning
Volpe and Wells took a double steal in the eighth inning
Judge gets in on the party with a base hit to right in the eighth inning
Judge steals second base in the eighth inning
Judge hits an RBI hit for Soto in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers goal was to get through a bullpen game without using their big bullpen pieces
The Yankees will have their ace Gerrit Cole on the hill as they try and force a return trip to LA for a Game 6
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees staved off elimination with Game 4 win
The Yankees are the first team since 1970 to extend a World Series to a fifth game when down three games to none
Miscellaneous Highlights: A fan was ejected for prying a ball out of Mookie Betts' glove
The game was a crucial win for the Yankees as they try to force a return trip to LA for a Game 6
